Yep. Called it.

I'm getting the feeling that this comic, and the last one, is topical.

Robots rule, I guess.
Hahahahaha! Poor Jeb...
Poor Jeb

Little does The rocket scientist who fired him know, he will soon be replaced by a robot. and soon, the world will be replaced!

GLORY TO ROBOTS!

(aka Poor Jeb <-- = Jeb)

Awww.

Come with me, Jeb. We'll make our own space agency, with blackjack and hookers!

In fact, forget the space agency.

Oh my god I'm so sad for Jeb D:

KILL THE JEB ROBOT!

Jeb BotÃ¢â€žÂ¢! "All the awesome, without any mistakes." And the whole time it pumps 200W of the latest hit tunes. Get your Jeb BotÃ¢â€žÂ¢ today! Or, is that a bipedal MechJeb? If so, we're all doomed.

Meanwhile in the KSC, the Jeb Robot is crashing several rockets, average wait period far shorter than Jeb's...

Edited September 4, 2013 by Designer225

In the words of the almighty internet...

FEELS
Jeb, such a BadS.

Echoing many previous comments...

Aww! Poor Jeb.
You... you can't do this to Jeb!

Can and did.

Don't worry. He's Jeb, he'll be fine.

PREDICTION ON WHAT WILL HAPPEN

Jeb gets a tank.

He goes to the KSC, and sees mechjeb flying a spaceship. He shoots it down, and grabs the debris.

He sells it at a museum, and gets enough money to make a better space program that the KSP.

PREDICTION ON WHAT WILL HAPPEN

Jeb gets a tank.

He goes to the KSC, and sees mechjeb flying a spaceship. He shoots it down, and grabs the debris.

He sells it at a museum, and gets enough money to make a better space program that the KSP.

Or in it's first docking, this mechanical jeb manages to burn off several large RCS tanks in 3 seconds and real Jeb is called in to tell them how to dock with SRB rockets only.

NOOOO!

Poor jeb

It's a MechJeb in kerbal scale!

But nothin' replaces the original. u_u
I liked the older comics better. The only real not-as-funny comics that you've made, in my opinion, is number 27, 29 and this one. Otherwise, they're great fun.

I liked the older comics better. The only real not-as-funny comics that you've made, in my opinion, is number 27, 29 and this one. Otherwise, they're great fun.

The last two weren't really supposed to be super funny. Some writers are able to seamlessly blend plot and comedy. I am sadly not quite as brilliant as, say, Rich Burlew. Nowhere near, in fact.
